results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where T(n,k) = T(n,k-1) + (k+1)*T(n-1,k) for n>k>0, T(n,0)=1 and T(n,n) = T(n,n-1) for n>=0.
comment: Main diagonal is A082161 (with offset). Row sums give A102317.

T(n,k) = number of column-marked subdiagonal paths of steps east (1,0) and north (0,1) from the origin to (n,k). Subdiagonal means that the path never rises above the diagonal line y=x and column-marked means that for 1 <= i <= n, one unit square directly below the i-th east step and above the line y=-1 is marked. - _David Callan_, Feb 04 2006
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 04 2005
